stimulusHtml: Which of the following factors would best explain Justinaâ€™s current belief about smoking?

features.html: Justina believed that she would never become addicted to smoking cigarettes because her parents taught her that it was wrong. Six months ago, she started smoking with her friends on weekends. Now she smokes throughout the week and believes that smoking is no worse than drinking coffee.

choicesHtml: Her highly authoritative parents likely contributed to her current belief.
Her growth mindset has led to a change in her beliefs about smoking.
Cognitive dissonance led to her current belief.
The sunk-cost fallacy influenced her current belief.
